summary: This bill, the 'Cracking Down on Price Gouging Act,' amends the Defense Production Act of 1950 to prohibit price gouging of certain materials and critical goods during times of scarcity. It defines "unfairly excessive price," including a presumptive 10% price increase, and outlines exceptions for legitimate business needs and uncontrollable costs. The bill specifies the meaning of "acute shortage" and defines "critical good." Penalties for violations include fines of up to $20,000 or 300% of the revenue generated.
